name: Matthijs van Essen
position 2: RSD Officer + Coordinator SOGI and religious conversion cases
field of studies 2: International Humanitarian Action - Conflict, Peacebuilding and Religion
skills: ['Christian Theology', 'Biblical Studies', 'Church History', 'Religious Studies', 'Philosophy', 'Biblical Hebrew', 'Ancient Greek', 'Social Sciences', 'Conflict and peace studies', 'Development Work', 'Humanitarian Assistance', 'Public Health', 'Sociology', 'Psychology', 'Cultural Anthropology', 'Political Science', 'International Humanitarian Law', 'Qualitative Research', 'Research Design', 'Product Promotion']
summary:
At the moment I am working at the Dutch Ministry of Justice and Security as a policy advisor, on the reception of Ukranian refugees in the Netherlands. 

For 3,5 years I worked as Refugee Status Determination Officier at the Dutch Immigration and Naturalisation Agency (IND). The essence of my job was to ensure that those who had fled from persecution and serious harm received the international protection they needed. 

More generally, my interests lie in the fields of international humanitarian action & migration, peacebuilding, religion and human (LGBTI) rights. 

I have excellent skills in writing, analyzing complex information, creating and maintaining networks and building bridges between various fields, departments and disciplines. I like to look at the bigger picture and to travel off the beaten track.

---
My professional story, in brief, is as follows. 

After growing up as a Christian, I studied Theology (BA) in Amsterdam. The ethics and philosophy that filtered out of my Theology Bachelors led me into studying humanitarian action, conflict and peace-building (MA). 

The organization I interned at as part of my studies, the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, gave me a formidable sense of working at a larger funder and coordinator of humanitarian assistence.

I wrote my Master thesis about the political construction of 'Dutch Christian Self versus Migrant Muslim Other'. This made me more aware of the way violence and exclusion are legitimized in political discourse. 

I got the chance to witness dynamics of violence and exclusion in real life when, for two months, I volunteered at a farm in the West Bank owned by a Palestinian family. 

My volunteering job at the International Fellowship of Reconciliation gave me insight into the work of an international peace organization. Additionally, it  provided experience in applying for funding at the EU.

Furthermore, it was a great pleasure for me to volunteer at the Amsterdam Rainbow Dress Foundation, creating awareness on state sponsored homophobia. The Amsterdam Rainbow Dress is a work of art traveling around the world. I was part of a small team managing its exposition, and took part in fundraising efforts.

~~~

Striving to approach the world in a combined idealistic and realistic way, I am slowly becoming who I want to be. Someone whose presence and actions have a positive, transformative impact on the people I engage with. Someone who contributes to overturning unjust structures, making room for peace.

name: Ineke Cornet
summary: Ineke Cornet is een ervaren docent op het gebied van theologie, spiritualiteit en literatuur in het tertiaire onderwijs met bijna 10 jaar buitenlandervaring.  Ze promoveerde in 2011 op een interdisciplinair proefschrift over middelnederlandse mystiek aan de KU Leuven (theologie) en Universiteit Antwerpen (Literatuurwetenschap). Ze heeft in Australië van 2012 tot 2016 als universitair docent les gegeven in door haar zelf ontwikkelde vakken over geschiedenis vande spiritualiteit aan de University of Divinity. Daarnaast doceerde zij ook algemene inleidingen tot de christelijke geloofsleer en de sacramenten aan de lerarenopleiding (Bachelor of Education) van de Australian Catholic University. Sinds 2017 heeft zij online colleges gegeven en een aantal  masterscripties begeleid. Op dit moment begeleidt zij twee PhD studenten aan de University of Divinity.

name: Dr. Kim Tsai  (Phd MSc)
field of studies 1: Working with affect:  affective relations with asylum seekers and refugees
skills: ['Change Management', 'Non-profits', 'Dutch', 'Government', 'Policy', 'Personal Development', 'Interim Management', 'Executive Coaching', 'Coaching', 'ICT', 'Management Consulting', 'Management Development', 'English', 'Management', 'Social Media', 'Process Management', 'Organizational Development', 'Operations Management', 'Public Policy']
summary:
I offer a path to peace, via private coaching, for people who want to know who they are behind the roles and masks.  I work with people who  see the urgency in learning to live authentically in relationship to themselves and others. 

I still occasionally do consultancy work for business, governmental and non-governmental organisations and sometimes I carry out research.  Ask if you're interested in my consultancy work. 

I don't have a fixed method.  I AM MY METHOD.  

I work with the living and the dying, combining my expertise of more than three decades working with individuals, groups, professionals, volunteers and marginalised groups (especially migrant women, refugees, the incarcerated and disenfranchised youth).  Combining academic learning, theory and practice is my speciality.  I use my  academic research (including a PhD on emotions and affect) and my training in spiritual care, theology and meditation to help me work with clients to gain self-awareness and increased inner peace.

summary:
I am a driven and disciplined graduate with 2 masters degrees in Literary Studies (research) and Old Testament. I taught both disciplines at college and university level. I speak 4 languages fluently and  I am good at 2 classical languages. My knack for languages makes me a good translator. 
I love reading hence my 2nd masters in Literary studies and I also love politics. I did a Dutch Christian Union Party masters class called “Masterclass Veelkleurig Talent van de ChristenUnie”; an introductory course to the  non-Dutch on the Dutch political system and the objectives and the ideology of the Christian Union Party. I am therefore a good debater and presenter and I want to be part of the policy making process or at least influence the process of policy making be it directly or indirectly.
I am also a researcher but I am also passionate about my current job as a teacher of English language. Some of the qualities one needs to have as a teacher and which I possess are: the ability to listen, empathy, patience, a good communicator, a policy maker, being a mother (in my case because I am a woman), being computer savvy (IT and Microsoft), problem solver, a good presenter, translator (particularly if you teach English as a second or third language). The list is endless. 

My hobbies are reading and running.

summary: Life, relationships, health & well-being, as normal as they are to all humans, to intentionally create the best of these significant areas of one's life is the most challenging to most people. How do you get the best out of the life you have been given? How do you deal with the set-backs of life? How do you overcome the pain of break-ups? How do you make crucial decisions while dealing with emotional upheaval? Would you believe that these have been my personal realities and having overcome and created the best version of myself and helping others do the same is what I am all about.

name: Arllen Ade, Ph.D.
degree 2: Bachelor's degree, Master's Degree in Pastoral Counseling, Ph.D. in Professional Counseling
skills: ['Adult Education', 'Higher Education', 'Public Speaking', 'Psychology', 'Distance Learning', 'Grant Writing', 'Teaching', 'University Teaching', 'Curriculum Design', 'Research', 'Microsoft Office', 'Community Outreach', 'Fundraising', 'Social Media', 'Qualitative Research', 'Curriculum Development', 'Editing', 'Statistics', 'Analysis', 'E-Learning']
summary:
Dr. Arllen Ade
(Counselor, Coach, Professor and Pastor in Northern Virginia)

Professional Counseling & Pastoral Experience:

I worked for Liberty University as a full-time professional counselor for a couple of years. I also served among students at several different levels, including in financial aid advising, guidance counseling, and as Chaplain for International Students on a university campus. Alongside doing itinerant preaching and teaching in Churches in a wide spectrum of denominations across the U.S, Canada, and the continent of Africa during the past 15 years, I have also been actively involved in Biblical counseling for the past three years. As a regional pastor for Mclean Bible Church – where I currently provide shepherding oversight for 2,500 members and attendees – a significant part of my responsibility is the practice of Biblical counseling. My primary counseling areas of focus have been on helping distressed marriages, treating process and behavioral addictions, and emotional disorders such as anxiety and depression.

Professor/Teaching Experience:

Formerly an Adjunct Professor for Liberty University teaching psychology and counseling online and residentially, I currently serve on my side job as a Resident Adjunct Professor who teaches counseling in seminary at the Washington University of Virginia. In my 7-year teaching career, here are some of the courses I have taught: Multicultural Counseling and Research Issues; Introduction to Christian Counseling; Theories in Counseling and Psychotherapy; Psychology of Personality; a Psychology Internship Course; etc. I have also worked as a Teaching Assistant for Liberty University’s Associate Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences. While serving in that office, I was involved in administrative duties such as course development, course edits, and the vetting and hiring of professors.

My Interests:
#publicspeaking
#lifecoaching
#counseling
#theology
#entrepreneurship

My Work:
Mclean Bible Church, Tyson's Location South Region Pastor

summary:
Elk kind is uniek, ieder mens is uniek. Het beste uit een mens halen op sociaal-emotioneel gebied en daarbij gebruik maken van de intellectuele kwaliteiten van diegene, maakt dat je samen verder komt. Een mens is meer dan een nummer.
De wereld verandert met de dag, je zult mee moeten met de veranderingen, je weg vinden in nieuwe dingen. Verder leren en innoveren is nodig om mee te gaan met deze veranderingen. Daar mogelijkheden en kansen zien, is verder kijken en verder gaan.
